item.title: Korea arrests CEO for adding DDoS feature to satellite receivers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: South Korean police have arrested a CEO and five employees for manufacturing over 240,000 satellite receivers pre-loaded or later updated to include DDoS attack functionality at a purchaser's request. [...]

item.title: Russia sentences Hydra dark web market leader to life in prison
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Russian authorities have sentenced the leader of the criminal group behind the now-closed dark web platform Hydra Market to life in prison. [...]

item.title: BootKitty UEFI malware exploits LogoFAIL to infect Linux systems
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The recently uncovered 'Bootkitty' UEFI bootkit, the first malware of its kind targeting Linux systems, exploits CVE-2023-40238, aka 'LogoFAIL,' to infect computers running on a vulnerable UEFI firmware. [...]

item.title: Mozilla really wants you to set Firefox as default Windows browser
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: In an effort to turn the tide, Mozilla is testing a fresh approach that could persuade more people to switch their default browser on Windows during the installation of the browser. [...]

item.title: Google Chromeâ€™s AI feature lets you quickly check website trustworthiness
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Google Chrome's upcoming feature uses AI to provide a summary of reviews from independent websites about the store or website you're visiting. [...]

item.title: Novel phishing campaign uses corrupted Word documents to evade security
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A novel phishing attack abuses Microsoft's Word file recovery feature by sending corrupted Word documents as email attachments, allowing them to bypass security software due to their damaged state but still be recoverable by the application. [...]

item.title: SpyLoan Android malware on Google Play installed 8 million times
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new set of 15 SpyLoan Android malware apps with over 8 million installs was discovered on Google Play, targeting primarily users from South America, Southeast Asia, and Africa. [...]

item.title: New Rockstar 2FA phishing service targets Microsoft 365 accounts
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new phishing-as-a-service (PhaaS) platform named 'Rockstar 2FA' has emerged, facilitating large-scale adversary-in-the-middle (AiTM) attacks to steal Microsoft 365 credentials. [...]

item.title: Russia arrests cybercriminal Wazawaka for ties with ransomware gangs
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Russian law enforcement has arrested and indicted notorious ransomware affiliate Mikhail Pavlovich Matveev (also known as Wazawaka, Uhodiransomwar, m1x, and Boriselcin) for developing malware and his involvement in several hacking groups. [...]

item.title: Bologna FC confirms data breach after RansomHub ransomware attack
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Bologna Football Club 1909 has confirmed it suffered a ransomware attack after its stolen data was leaked online by the RansomHub extortion group. [...]
